title: Babies Behind Bars
description: Follow the emotional journeys of inmates who give birth behind bars and are permitted to stay with their newborns in a prison maternity wing.

title: Bad Rap
description: Four young Asian-American rappers strive to achieve success on their own terms in a musical genre that often treats them as outsiders.
actors: Jonathan Park, Awkwafina, David Lee, Richard Lee

title: Banking on Bitcoin
description: Featuring interviews with enthusiasts and experts, this documentary covers Bitcoin's roots, its future and the technology that makes it tick.

title: Barbershop Punk
description: The subjects of file swapping and censorship get a human face with the story of a barbershop singer who fought the country's biggest cable provider.
actors: Robb Topolski, Janeane Garofalo, Henry Rollins, Wes Armstrong

title: Be Here Now
description: Trace the brave journey of actor Andy Whitfield, who received a devastating cancer diagnosis while starring in the series "Spartacus: Blood and Sand."

title: Before the Flood
description: Leonardo DiCaprio crisscrosses the globe to investigate the consequences of man-made globe warming and the measures being taken to reverse it.

title: Behind Closed Doors
description: Victims of domestic violence bravely face the camera as they describe the horrors they've endured at the hands of those they love.

title: Being Elmo: A Puppeteer's Journey
description: Whoopi Goldberg narrates Elmo creator Kevin Clash's remarkable journey from a working-class Baltimore neighborhood to Jim Henson's "Sesame Street."

title: Being George Clooney
description: Go behind the scenes with actors from around the world who supply the voice of George Clooney in dubbed versions of American blockbusters.

title: Being Napoleon
description: On the 200th anniversary of the Battle of Waterloo, thousands of enthusiasts reenact the epic clash. But there can only be one Napoleon.

title: Best and Most Beautiful Things
description: This documentary focuses on Michelle Smith, a legally blind young woman with Asperger's syndrome who approaches her 20s with courage and curiosity.

title: Best of Enemies
description: The long, bitter rivalry between politically opposed intellectuals Gore Vidal and William F. Buckley Jr. is recounted in this acclaimed documentary.

title: Best Worst Thing That Ever Could Have Happened
description: The cast and crew of the 1981 Broadway musical "Merrily We Roll Along" recall joy and heartbreak during the production of a surefire hit that wasn't.
actors: Stephen Sondheim, Harold Prince, Jason Alexander, Mandy Patinkin

title: Betting on Zero
description: This documentary dives into the complex world of Herbalife, the international nutritional products company accused of being a pyramid scheme.

title: Beyond JFK
description: This nonfiction companion to Oliver Stone's "JFK" looks at the investigation into and conspiracy theories around the Kennedy assassination.

title: Big in Bollywood
description: An Indian-American actor from L.A. struggles with fame when he becomes an overnight comedy star thanks to his leading role in a hit Bollywood movie.

title: Big Time
description: In this documentary, architect Bjarke Ingels offers his vision for 2 World Trade Center as he aims to restore Manhattan's skyline to its former glory.

title: Bigfoot
description: Wildlife cameraman John Waters travels to the forests of the Pacific Northwest in search of the elusive cryptozoological specimen known as Bigfoot.

title: Biggie & Tupac
description: British documentarian Nick Broomfield investigates the murders of rappers Tupac Shakur and Biggie Smalls, digging up some surprises in the process.

title: Bill Nye: Science Guy
description: The dynamic, bow-tied host behind the young adult science show faces climate-change skeptics as he demonstrates the importance of scientific evidence.
actors: Bill Nye, Neil deGrasse Tyson, Eugenie Scott, Francis Collins

title: Birth of a Movement
description: In 1915, newspaper editor William Monroe Trotter mobilized against a lauded racist epic, becoming a forerunner of the civil rights movement to follow.

title: Blackfish
description: This fascinating documentary examines the life of performing killer whale Tilikum, who has caused the deaths of several people while in captivity.

title: Blood on the Mountain
description: This historically expansive film examines the coal-mining traditions of West Virginia -- and the affiliated corporate interests that often risk lives.

title: Blue Gold: American Jeans
description: Vintage jeans enthusiast Eric Schrader travels the globe in search of rare denim while exploring how blue jeans conquered culture and fashion.

title: Blurred Lines: Inside the Art World
description: Artists and industry insiders shed light on the commercial forces behind the veneer of genius and glamour that often shrouds contemporary art.

title: Bobbi Jene
description: This candid profile follows dancer Bobbi Jene Smith as she leaves the company of Israeli choreographer Ohad Naharin to forge her own artistic path.

title: Bobby Kennedy for President
description: Historic footage and leading voices of the era examine the "Bobby Phenomenon" of the 1960s and the legacy of the man who helped redefine the country.

title: Bobby Sands: 66 Days
description: In 1981, an imprisoned Irish Republican Army soldier went on a hunger strike that galvanized his movement and made him a controversial global icon.

title: Bombshell: The Hedy Lamarr Story
description: An unearthed audio interview of Hollywood icon Hedy Lamarr reveals a woman with brains as well as beauty, who was the first to patent frequency hopping.

title: Breaking a Monster
description: In this documentary, the Brooklyn teenage heavy-metal street band Unlocking the Truth launches into the big leagues of touring and the music industry.

title: Brothers in War
description: Home movies, audio tapes and letters from members of Charlie Company, the last U.S. platoon sent to Vietnam, illuminate the conflict as never before.

title: Burlesque: Heart of the Glitter Tribe
description: This revealing documentary probes the onstage personas of Portland, Oregon, burlesque performers who practice wildly different art forms.
